Dear Parents,

Today we had an incident where a student made a threat against the high school. Other students heard the comment and reported it to a teacher. The teacher immediately contacted the office and the assistant principal located the student quickly. The student’s belongings were checked and there was no instrument with which to carry out the threat. The police were called, and school punishment had been initiated. We are very proud of our students and employees for taking this comment seriously and reporting it swiftly. Columbus ISD will not tolerate any threats, whether they are substantiated or unsubstantiated. The student in question is a minor and the district will not / cannot release any other information.

At CISD, we take student and employee safety very seriously. We will complete our investigation and handle this according to all applicable laws and policies. We will also work with the Columbus Police Department.

At CISD, we take student safety very seriously. We will complete our investigation and handle this according to all applicable laws and policies.

We are glad to know that our other students knew to tell and did. We are also proud that our driver took immediate action. No students were harmed.

post_text: First graders are learning the importance of community beliefs, customs, and traditions. One such custom and tradition is the scarecrow. Farmers have used Scarecrows to scare the crows away as far back as the Greeks. Scarecrows became a custom for farmers such as the Native Americans, the First Settlers of the Colonies, and during the depression. They now are a recognized fall tradition that signifies a bountiful harvest. In keeping with this tradition, First graders have made Scarecrows for sale through a silent auction. The scarecrows are on display in the CES lobby. The silent auction will end Thursday, October 13th at 3:30 p.m. Take a look at the photos I just published.
